summary: This document is a chain of emails between FBI personnel discussing the location and status of the yacht 'The Dancing Hare', formerly named after Ghislaine Maxwell and associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The emails originate from an FBI Legal Attach√© in Palau who discovered the yacht docked there and relay information up the chain to the lead case agent for the Epstein matter in New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as the person the yacht was formerly named after prior to its name change to 'The Dancing Hare'. The ship's association with her is noted as a reason for tracking by conspiracy theorists.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the underlying case. The emails concern the location of his yacht, 'The Dancing Hare', and whether the case agents have any interest or seizure orders for it.

connections.description: The yacht 'The Dancing Hare' is described as having an association with both individuals, having been formerly named after Maxwell and owned by Epstein's entity.

events.title: Yacht Arrival in Palau
events.description: The yacht 'The Dancing Hare' reportedly arrived in a Palau port.

events.title: Possible Yacht Arrival in Noumea
events.description: The yacht may have arrived in Noumea (New Caledonia) around mid-August 2021, though tracking data is inconsistent.

events.title: Yacht Docked in New Zealand
events.description: The yacht spent a lot of time, since at least the beginning of 2020, docked in various ports throughout New Zealand, including Westhaven, Auckland.

keyFacts: The yacht 'The Dancing Hare', associated with Jeffrey Epstein and formerly named after Ghislaine Maxwell, was located docked in Palau as of December 2021.
FBI personnel in Palau and Canberra were coordinating to determine if the U.S. case agents had any interest in the vessel or any active seizure orders.
The yacht's ownership is described as 'murky', but it is linked to 'Moonstone Enterprises LLC'.
The vessel had spent significant time docked in New Zealand and Australia prior to its arrival in Palau.
The ship's movements were being tracked by 'conspiracy theorist-types' due to its Epstein/Maxwell connections.
